repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: we try to avoid direct calls to `update_screen` if possible. would `redraw_later(curwin, VALID)` work?
No. Screen does not redraw,if replaced `update_screen` to `redraw_later(curwin, VALID)`
buffer content changed, shouldn't it be NOT_VALID instead ?
That redraws everything which is wasteful. I would try `redrawWinline(wp, line)` first.

Not fixed. It only shows one line. Others stay not refreshed
EDIT: when inserting more than one line,everything shows up except first one.
Fixed. I inserted `redrawWinline(curwin,lnum)` a bit too far. Now its fixed using `redrawWinline(curwin,lnum)`

comment_regular_data.body: seems reasonable now :) maybe a test?

> seems reasonable now :) maybe a test?

I'm new to this open-source project. So by test it means `make test` ?
yes, `functionaltest` to be more specific. look for tests in `test/functional/ui/*_spec.lua` for examples of screen tests.

> yes, `functionaltest` to be more specific. look for tests in `test/functional/ui/*_spec.lua` for examples of screen tests.

Ran some tests. `functionaltest` Without fix had 9 fails,and with had 4 fails. `screen_basic_spec.lua` ran withouta a problem
EDIT: Error count is the same as in master
may I ask, why is the lint check failing? it seems like I didn't change anything, only added a few lines

when you change code, the linter checks for the neighboring lines of your patch (right before and right after): it allows to refactor the codebase incrementally rather than just refactor everything at once.
see https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/14175/checks?check_run_id=2176786800#step:11:225 for the errors. 

Also the errors are diffed against a list of errors on master so it's a good idea to rebase usually.
I guess everything's good now after updating the fork
My lint check is failing with more and more things. Should I change the pre-increment or just leave it as is?
when you address a linter issue, this changes the line and so the linter looks into the next neighbors, so you can end up changing many lines as it propagates.
So, if I understand correctly if I try to fix things, I will just make things worse. And, if I'm done with everything, I just change the title to [RDY]?
And thank you for all the time. I'll try to ask less in the future.
